edu.rit.gpu

Class GpuLongArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.gpu.GpuVbl
      • edu.rit.gpu.GpuArray
        • edu.rit.gpu.GpuLongArray

  • public class GpuLongArray
extends GpuArray
    Class GpuLongArray provides a long integer array GPU variable. This is an array of type long stored in the GPU's memory and mirrored in the CPU's memory.

    Class GpuLongArray supports mirroring all of the GPU's data array in the CPU's memory, mirroring only a portion of the GPU's data array in the CPU's memory, or mirroring none of the GPU's data array. Class GpuLongArray provides operations for copying all or portions of the data array from the CPU to the GPU or from the GPU to the CPU.

    To use a long integer array GPU variable:

    1. Construct an instance of class GpuLongArray by calling either the getLongArray() method on a Gpu object or the getLongArray() method on a Module object, specifying the length of the array and (optionally) the length of the array portion mirrored in the CPU.

    2. Set the item field's elements to the desired values. Call the hostToDev() method to copy the mirrored portion of the array from CPU memory to GPU memory.

    3. Pass the GpuLongArray object as an argument of a GPU kernel function call. In the GPU code, this becomes a pointer (type long long int* or unsigned long long int*) to an array of N data elements, where N is the length of the array. The GPU code sets the array's elements to the desired values.

    4. Call the devToHost() method to copy the mirrored portion of the array from GPU memory to CPU memory. Examine the values of the item field's elements.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      long[] item
      The mirrored portion of the long integer array in CPU memory.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void devToHost(int dstindex, int srcindex, int len)
      Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
      void hostToDev(int dstindex, int srcindex, int len)
      Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory.

        public final long[] item

    • Method Detail

      • hostToDev

        public void hostToDev(int dstindex,
             int srcindex,
             int len)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the host CPU's memory to the GPU device's memory. len elements starting at index srcindex in the CPU array are copied to the GPU array starting at index dstindex.
        Specified by:
        hostToDev in class GpuArray
        Parameters:
        dstindex - GPU array starting index.
        srcindex - CPU array starting index.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstindex < 0, srcindex < 0, len < 0, dstindex+len > length(), or srcindex+len > cpuLength().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public void devToHost(int dstindex,
             int srcindex,
             int len)
        Copy the given portion of this GPU array from the GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory. len elements copied starting at index srcindex in the GPU array are copied to the CPU array starting at index dstindex.
        Specified by:
        devToHost in class GpuArray
        Parameters:
        dstindex - CPU array starting index.
        srcindex - GPU array starting index.
        len - Number of elements to copy.
        Throws:
        IndexOutOfBoundsException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if dstindex < 0, srcindex < 0, len < 0, dstindex+len > cpuLength(), or srcindex+len > length().
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.
